qualitative.reasoning: Bank of India demonstrates strong financial momentum with a 3-year profit CAGR of ~39% and improving asset quality (GNPA reduced to 3.69%). While free cash flow is negative (typical for expanding banks due to loan disbursements), credit growth is robust at ~15%. The stock trades at a low P/E of 6.6, suggesting undervaluation relative to growth. Management has effectively reduced NPAs and maintained a healthy Capital Adequacy Ratio.
